result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Video
Personal service notice dated 10/05/2022 was not provided to Attorney Buckett as attorney is required to opt in under Wis. Stats. 801.18(3)(a)1 and 801.18(5)(e).

10:00 AM Defendant Timothy J Gahagan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Timothy J Gahagan.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel advises court as to current status, requesting adjournment to allow for rescheduled pretrial with DA's office.  Counsel requests date for plea and sentencing.  Statements by Defendant as to prompt disposition request.  Court reviews the record with parties, finding no prompt disposition request in the record.  Court examines defendant as to right to appear for next hearing.  Defendant wishes to appear for next hearing by video.  Court accepts the waiver of in person appearance.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Video
Submitted by the State.  Forwarded to b3 jdash.

11:15 AM (cases called 22CF101; 22TR692; 22TR693; 22TR694) Defendant Timothy J Gahagan appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs defendant that Atty Leech is withdrawing due to new employment. Court will set matter over for the Public Defender's office to re-appoint. Atty Buckett in court and now appears as a friend of the court. Counsel will contact the public defender and will accept this case.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy J Gahagan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Timothy J Gahagan.  Court examines Defendant as to submitted waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and binds the defendant over for trial.  State files information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading, and enters not guilty pleas.  Counsel requests traffic cases to track.  State to prepare video OTP for next appearance.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Further proceedings on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
DCI unable to schedule video conference for 11:30 hearing.  Per the court, hearing rescheduled to allow for video appearance of Defendant.  VCON confirmed with DCI.

Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Timothy J Gahagan. Request for preliminary hearing. Bail motion heard. State opposes any reduction in cash bail.  Counsel and defendant put in zoom breakout room to discuss defendants request to speak regarding the bail motion.  
2:32pm Case recalled, same appearances. Defendant allowed to clarify the recent sentences he had just received in Sheboygan cases. Court denies bail motion.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

1:15 PM Defendant Timothy J Gahagan appeared by video, in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court finds probable cause. Defendant has a probation hold. Traffic cases to track with 22CF101. State recommends $100,000.00 cash bail w/conditions. Court order $50,000.00 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant can request court appointed counsel, if wishes to do so. Court finds good cause for extending time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
